Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dhahran
Reviews.Content: The best breakfast menu....ever with an amazing view of the Bosphorus. The rooms are modestly sized but functional and modern in design. the location is convenient and close to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “My visit to Istanbul from 29/3/2012”
Reviews.Author: salsuwaidi
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent and the services was really nice with nice people at the hotel was supporting us, the room was small. The view from the hotel to the BOSPHORUS was really nice. One thing was really in this hotel the noise coming from the next building which is open night clubs having very loudly speaker and the sound of it coming inside our rooms like we are with them, too much noise till 4am which you cant sleep!! that was really very bad and the hotel can't do anything about them.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE TO HAVE A SHORT LEAVE FOR RELAXATION”
Reviews.Author: ajmisa0h
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to stay short period. I stay with my wife one week in this hotel and We found it excellent, location, the team worker was found outstanding peeformer and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “expensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: rjagga
Reviews.Content: was there for a family holiday. rooms were comfortable but a tight with an extra bed for our son. generally i found the hotels in turkey to be expensive so in comparison this one does not seem expensive for the price i paid. the location was good but the approach main road was always chocked and thus took a long time getting there. breakfast was great and the deck by the river was beautiful during the early winter sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_spring
Reviews.Content: I like the Radisson chain generally anwyay, so was especially pleased when I ws booked to stay here for 3 nights. The location is fantastic and evrything was absolutely first class, ouldnt be aulted. Cant say more than that!

Reviews.Title: “A good quality Radisson with great views”
Reviews.Author: Jamesbrien
Reviews.Content: First the bad news, I booked a standard room for â‚¬160 per night and you don't get a view of the Bosphorous. To get a room with a view you need to upgrade to a business class room but at â‚¬320 per night I politely declined. The receptionist had an alternative - enjoy the view from the bar - and he had a point. The bar area is cool, with amazing views of the Bosphorous and the bridge that crosses to the Asian side. I ate at the bar, the menu was limited but I can recommend the ravioli. The room was small but clean. My view was a wall and if I was staying longer I would have changed it. The hotel boasts a Hamman (Turkish Bath). I had a Hamman and a massage and whilst I can recommend it I thought it was a bit expensive at 230 lira. If you have more time or are organized you should go to one of the original hamman's in town - Cagaloglu Hamami looks particularly good - www.cagalogluhamami.com.tr The gym was adequate and breakfast was the usual Radisson level. The hotel is not in the centre but 3 miles away from the old town. However I really liked the location. Right on the river - you can walk to some very nice bars and restaurants and the centre is only a quick cab ride away. Overall a good choice but just make sure you are happy with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ARCHIE0410
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a really lovely location on the Bosphorous. It has a beautiful outdoor terrace which I would imagine in the summer is gorgeous. The rooms are really nice and state of the art. I had a room overlooking the Bosphorous which are sold at a premium (50 Euros supplement per night). The rooms not overlooking the Bophorous have views over the adjacent streets. I didn't actually make use of the facilities, but the hotel does have a nice spa. The main restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner was fine. Bar prices are expensive, but that seems to be the norm all over the world. Free WIFI which always gets a thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “Mighty nice property, outstanding views!”
Reviews.Author: Kitcat22
Reviews.Content: The only thing about this hotel that I didn't love is the fact that it's right on the Bosphorus instead of the historic old city. I don't know which room rates include the breakfast buffet, but hopefully yours will. They do a fine job covering cuisines suited to their international clientele as well as the traditional Turkish breakfast. Convenient to public transportation, though local taxis are quite affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views....and a nice area to stay”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: This has been my 3rd visit to Istanbul. Twice I stayed in the Teksim area. This time I decided something different; to stay at Ortakoy. This area is bang on the Bosphorus. The only other 2 hotels besides this one are the Four Seasons and Cigran Palace. Both of these are upwards of 400 euros a night. Radisson is half the price and pretty damn good. It is located in a small alley at the end of Cigran Palace. I had booked online and got a rate of 195 euros for a standard partial sea view room. The room is decent size. The sea view is also pretty decent although not direct but at an angle. Comfortable bed and a really powerful shower. The room is pretty good not to warrant an upgrade to the next category. The hotel also has free wifi. The food and drinks are expensive in the hotel. The area is pretty lively (although nothing compared to Teksim). Within a 3 minute walk there are about 15-20 bars and cafes where you can eat and drink and also have a turkish water pipe (nargile). A lot of these are on the sea front with a great view. I checked out and to catch my flight but did not get a ticket that day so came back to the hotel. While the hotel looked empty they conveniently had no standard rooms available and the desk pushed a business class room on me. I did get a bit of a discount on that room type but it was clear that the person at check in new I needed the room and was pushing me a higher revenue room. This was unprofessional. The rate did include breakfast. The business class room was bigger. I had one on the 5th floor and here you had a direct view of the Bosphorus from one side of windows and an angled view from the other. It was a bit bigger in size. Everything else was almost the same as the standard room. The breakfast in the morning was nice. I personally like Ortakoy a lot more than the hustle bustle of Teksim or Sultanahmet and I love the sea view. So I will repeat the hotel in future. And for 195 euros its not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: fhpete
Reviews.Content: A brand you know - and it certainly doesn't disappoint. Style throughout is modern and clean. Staff is pleasant and helpful. You can't beat the location - right on the Bosphorus with lots to see and do in the immediate area around the hotel. I was told I had a view of the Bosphorus, but really, my room looked out over neighboring buildings....with a view of the water to the side. This will be the case of a majority of rooms, I think. The bar is modern and beautiful. I was only there for two nights on business. I travel a ton and find myself to be quite discerning. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “After circling the world twice, this hotel is by far my favorite: Location - Location - Location.”
Reviews.Author: csam48
Reviews.Content: This hotel serves up one the most unique spots in all of Istanbul. Located roughly 30 minutes from the airport, 20 minutes to Sultan Ahmet Square, 10 minutes to Dolmabache Palace, 7 Minutes to Taxsim Square and 30 seconds to one of the safest spots in all of Istanbul â€“ Ortakoy, this hotel is the best for families. This place will take your breath away at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Have breakfast feet from the Bosphorus River while watching the seagulls, ships and small boats sail by. You will also see the mosque and bridge. It is truly my most favorite spots in all of Istanbul. For lunch you can choose from many of the higher end places or sneak across the street and enjoy kofte, icli kofte and cig kofte, all staples in Turkish cuisine. As for dinner, the sky is the limit in Istanbul. I highly recommend the restaurant located above the Storks Jewelry store located next to the Spice Bazaar. The views at night are some of the best. Then there is the night life around the hotel. If you want to drop $5 for a beer or $30 at a club you can. The hookah bars are located right on the water as are many of the bars. Moving back to the hotelâ€¦the driveway is a little steep, so be careful. But you are always greeted at the door and the service is amazing. The lobby bar is very tastefully and eloquently decorated and the lobby is beautiful too, but the drinks are a pricey. The amenities are great and the rooms are updated, but you wonâ€™t spend much time in there anyway. You can ask for a view of the street or Bosphorus overlooking the palace. The mini-bar is nice but very expensive. My recommendation, walk across the street and buy your Raki, water, beer and snacks. Lastly is the staff. This places sets a high bar for hotels in the area and I have only come across a handful of others that come place. I spent for years in Turkey and traveled to almost every province. Please donâ€™t hesitate to ask me anything. Istanbul is a great city, but be careful. With 18 million people and all walks of life keep your valuables locked up, cameras around your neck and money/wallets in your front pockets. One last tip â€“ going to stay long at the hotel? Ask for the suites located in the adjacent building â€“ YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great experience”
Reviews.Author: FoodDetective
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting in Istanbul. On the same weekend my wife has her birthday. To stay in this hotel made me possible to combine both. Excellent view at Bosphorus shore... The service is great, maybe the best in the city. The only few critics are the noisy surronding (poor window sealing) and traffic. The restaurants are promising both, good meal and to see "people" in the Turkish jet society.

Reviews.Title: “Young Design Hotel (ok)”
Reviews.Author: rodolfo3200
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Having been in Istanbul for some time, I looked for a hotel which had a better location and affordable prices, at little above US$200 there was the Radisson facing the Bosphorus, paying for an upgrade for a Bosphorus view room is totally worth it, plus the arrival was welcoming and fast. STAFF: The staff is what makes a difference, for a hotel that is considerably small and doesnâ€™t offer a swimming pool what would motivate me to visit the Radisson again is their incredible staff, Mr. Faith and his team made me feel at home, everybody efforts themselves to the maximum and service is VERY FAST, they do all that is requested literally on touch of a button, the in-room phone is easy, you touch one single button for any need and it is fulfilled ASAP. HOTEL/LOCATION: A very young and bright hotel, all new and welcoming design, recommended for young couples and such, the rooms have low ceiling but are decently well designed, A/C works well, the hotel has an OK very small spa and the food and breakfast/bars areas are very wide, expect a decent breakfast and cozy restaurants, plus the ZUMA is right next door, amazing Japanese food. OVERALL: First time in Istanbul? Can be a very good choice, relatively near to all malls and some of the attractions it is destined to young couples or people who donâ€™t mind to stay in traffic jams to get back to the hotel or out of it during any of the peak hours, the traffic is awful but the area, Ortakoy, is totally worth it, amazing views, great restaurants all around, easy to reach banking and laundry, pharmacies, anything within a couple of blocks, and the incredible small cafes or Ortakoy all very cozy too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: Hashdxb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend and booked it over the internet. Having done a last minute reservation, we were surprised to find this hotel priced at the same level as another hotel next door. The staff were very helpful and always welcome you with a smile, the location is just unbelievable, right in front of Bosphorus with great views. But when i checked out the hotel next door was actually offering a slightly cheaper rate and that for a suite, that completely put me off and checked out after 2 days. We were booked for 5 nights. An hour after checking out, I had forgotten something in the toilet. Called the hotel right away to keep it and i will come to pick up in a few hours. When I called back to see when i can come to pick it up, they said, the house keeping didn't find anything at all. I was shocked and dissappointed to hear that. how can it be gone in such a short time. I wont ever return back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small but cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mb4ever
Reviews.Content: good location, great views (though not all rooms have a view of the bosphorous), great food with a warm and hospitable staff. It is pretty close to the jetty and nice cafes.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchmannl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, not only because it is at the Bosphorus waterfront, but also is it is almost next to a nice area full of bars, restaurants etc. The rooms are good, I liked the design of it and the size. I got a corner room on the sixt floor, on the street side of the hotel, so as far as possible from the Bosphorus, but still had this great view over the Bosphorus. Free decent Wifi in the whole hotel, which is great. Breakfast is nicely presented and a good choice of food. The restaurants and bars are obviously overlooking the Bosphorus. But the service of both could have been better. It was often difficult to get the attention of the staff. Officially this is a 5 star hotel, but it did not give me the feeling of a real 5 star hotel, more a good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class stay”
Reviews.Author: Jgelley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here following my business week in and aroung istanbul. The welcome was warm, the hotel staff, without exception, helpful & friendly. We were allocated a front room (complimentary upgraded) with a tremendous view across the water. Our room could not have been better. The buffet breakfast on the outside terrace was excellent, both in terms of food quality/choice and location. Throughout the stay, the hotel staff were keen and attentive. I cannot find fault at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CPLongIsland
Reviews.Content: We had great views of the Bosphorus from our compact and very modern room. We could find every amenity we needed in our room, except for a 110-120 volt outlet to charge our N. American gadgets. The breakfast was first rate in terms of the variety and quality of the selection. This is not an inexpensive hotel but you would be hard pressed to find anything cheaper, at a similar location offering same level of service, in Istanbul these days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: eileen c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a 50th birthday celebration for 3 nights. It is a little out of the main city but so much better for that. Take a tram to the end of the line and walk! Perfect location to go back to at the end of a busy day admiring all Instanbul has to offer. A little oasis of calm in the bustling city. Starboard Restaurant was not only great for buffet breakfast but also for a romantic dinner. Food was delightful with attentive, friendly staff. Reception staff especially Tanner) were wonderful, could not have been more helpful or friendly even when we asked for info, taxis, restaurants bookings in the city, water taxis etc. ( we are quite demanding guests I think!) Room was wonderful with the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in for a while. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and thanks to all at the hotel who made my stay such a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting and free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: hongo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here for. 3 nights. The hotel breakfast was incredible, and the bar served excellent drinks at night....all with gorgeous waterfront location. So relaxing to be there. Our room was very nice and we loved the free wifi. Located in the Ortokoy neighborhood which is really nice, and has a fun Sunday market to walk around. Staying on the bosphorus is further from the main tourist attractions...but so nice and relaxing. We had a driver and guide for our 3 days so it didn't matter at all to be a few minutes drive from the tourist attractions. Nice to be away from the crowded areas the tourists often stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of breakfast”
Reviews.Author: traveler2100
Reviews.Content: For a $25 continental breakfast, you would expect more than four pieces if toast OR a cup of yogurt, and no fruit, juice or anything. Coffe even cost extra. When I explained this to the front desk, the receptionist literally ignored me. Out of sheer fascination, I tried two more times, always politely, and eventually gave up after zero response. Overall, location is great, but rooms are small and damp for the price, and the shower-tub is downright frightening to get into. For a better option in the neighborhood, go to the House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “expencive, and romantic”
Reviews.Author: christinelv
Reviews.Content: To nights to start our romantic vacation was a good choice. Ortakoy is a busy area and have lots to see in walking distance from the hotel. A pier has ferry tours on the bosphorous also. The view from the hotel is nice with boats to and from on the water. We had dinner by the water and food was good but not excellent. Drinks on the terrace is nice but service is not excellent, they are kind of slow. the staff in the reseption are too stuck up. when we asked for ferries on the bosphorous all they could offer was an expensive boat that you could rent. their english was not good either so we gave up and found a ferry ourselves. It looks like they try to hard to get a high maintainance hotel and forget to listen to the guest. the breakfast was very nice, lots of choices.. and a chef that liked to take brakes often but cooked omeletes on request. room was small but clean (we had a standard double). I would not go to this hotel again, its a one time experience because it was not good value for my money, I expected better service when i pay this much.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional Radisson”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights at the Radisson Bosphorus, and have only good things to say about the property. The room, a business class with terrace, was quite large, new, with all the amenities, and a lovely terrace with view over Bosphorus. Housekeeping did an excellent job, and the hotel was extremely clean. Service was good and efficient. Room service and breakfast were of high quality, and the buffet spread was quite elaborate. The location, right by the Bosphorus, on the busy Ortakoy area, was good. It is a nice area of the city, although a bit removed from the center. Free wifi, as in all Radissons, is a plus. All in all, Radisson is an excellent hotel, and I wouldn't hesitate suggesting it to everyone who's seeking for a classy stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “quite nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: DrEric108
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Rooms very clean. And the restaurant is RIGHT on the river with good food too. The desk staff could be a bit more helpful. The area around the hotel is busy (sort of Soho like) but it is a ways to the grand bazaar and most major attractions. And Taxis in Istanbul are a PAIN. Read up on them or get seriously fleeced.

Reviews.Title: “Cool 5-star waterfront with deck terrace”
Reviews.Author: Lulgiss
Reviews.Content: If your criteria is "Bosphoris view + Deck restaurant", this should be your place. Hotel is a far from the historic center but there are also other things to do and see in Istabul. Very friendly place with a very trendy sushi restaurant. But remerber, Istanbul is a big and expensive city, watch for the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...........”
Reviews.Author: gilesh71
Reviews.Content: I get that SAS Radisson Blu have a standard worldwide which is sort of clean cut clinical efficiency, but what a huge waste of the most wonderful location. The hotel should be closed and given to someone prepared to make the most of the incredible location. Service - awful. They didn't care. At 930 am we asked for help to find a Bosphorus cruise. They sent us to a terminal nearby which didn't open until 230 pm ! The bar staff were awful. We paid double the rate of a Sultanehmet hotel which was 10 times better - we'd recommend Hotel Ibrahim Pasha near the blue mosque. That place is awesome, great hospitality, they make more of their roof top terrace view than the Radisson does with it's waterfront position. And half the price of the Radisson. Also, the "partial" Bosporus view we paid for at the Radission was a waste of money. We wanted to open the window to breathe in the Bosphorus air but had to keep it closed because of the awful noise from the hotel aircon system outside and the 6am wake-up call from the garbage trucks. So disappointing, given the expense, made worse by the 2 preceding nights at the awesome Hotel Ibrahim Pasha. Don't book the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!”
Reviews.Author: Rati_N58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the radission blu over the summer. The receptionists were friendly and the location of the hotel is good but the rest was AWFUL! Our room was noisy! It had a weird smell. For the price we paid we got a raw deal. I used to dread going back to the room. At the bar I ordered a Mojito and it was full of ants, I had to change it 3 times over and it always had dead ants in it. The staff was not at all apologetic. Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Modern but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinamilk
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is great and worth to include in the daily rate. Enjoy the restaurants close to the hotel. Zuma is a very nice Japanese and Anjelique is a good lounge. Take the train to the last station to avoid the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “It was expensive”
Reviews.Author: paonpaon
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was good if you are going for business. It is quite far from any attractions. The room tariff of 235 euros plus tax was steep for the kind of rooms they have. But the staffs were excellent and cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled... on the water... great view from some rooms... but VERY far from town”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: This is one of the VERY few newly renovated 4-5 star hotels in all of Istanbul... and it's only one of three hotels actually on the Bosphorus (the other two are the Four Seasons Bosphorus and the Kempinski Cirigan Palace). We stayed here because it is the least expensive one (by far, most of the time). IF you can get a room that faces Sultanahment (the older part of town with Haghia Sophia and Topkapi Palace) on the fourth floor or higher, Iâ€™d stay here again (I think the category is called Superior). If not, there are some less-than-great rooms and views and itâ€™s a long way away from town. The hotel is a couple of miles from Sultanahmet and is virtually under the first Bosphorus bridge in a charming waterfront neighborhood named Ortakoy. Itâ€™s a 45-60 minute brisk walk from the last stop on the tram (or 15 minute bus ride). As a result, you will be spending a LOT of time in taxis, on buses (which are fine to take and cheap but are VERY crowded) and trams (also, cheap, easy but get A LOT of use) to get anywhere. There is just one waterfront road out to the hotel. Itâ€™s only 3 lanes and, as a result, very crowded on weekends and at rush hour. We read a lot about getting ripped off by cab drivers in Istanbul on this site, so we stuck to the buses and trams (atypical for us) until our trip back to the airport... of course, we didn't have any problems with the driver on that trip so maybe we played it too safe. The hotel is newly remodeled, and they did a great job with the redo. It doesn't have much of a presence on the main road, however. The property is long and narrowâ€¦ not much frontage on the water or street. Most rooms have side views (except for a few suites in front and a few rooms on the street), and if you are on a low floor or too close to the street, you won't have a view and you will hear a lot of traffic noise, especially on weekends. The rooms were nicely furnished and newly done, but are small. The designers cleverly conceal that fact with mirrors so it doesn't feel claustrophobic. Just know there's not a lot of room in your room. A big plus was the free wifi in your roomâ€¦ it engendered a lot of good will from us. The staff was nice and friendly every time we had to contact them. We had dinner in the main restaurant once (thereâ€™s also a popular-with-upscale locals sushi restaurant)â€¦ excellent pepperoni pizza for 26 Turkish lira. It's not on the main menu, but ask for it. The location of the restaurant is greatâ€¦ right on the water and the night weekend manager was really pleasant. We had breakfast at a Starbucks about three blocks away every day and found a grocery store and liquor store in the same area, so it's pretty convenient for stuff you'll need. We had drinks & dinner in the bar at the Four Seasons Bosphorus every night... great service, excellent food. That hotel has a beautiful promenade on the water. The public spaces are stunning, as is the restaurant Aqua. You canâ€™t see the Bosphorus too well from the bar, but you can eat/drink outside weather permitting. Also checked out the Kempinski Cirigan Palace (friendly staff but tired-looking facilities... WAY overrated and full of loud Americans with name tags... and basketball hoops on the Bosphorus in front of the old palace section... what ARE they thinking?) and the Ritz-Carlton up the hill, which is like a stuffy trip back to 1992 (but again, with a friendly staff)â€¦ beware, they donâ€™t even mow the lawn in the entrance area! Istanbul doesn't have too many hotels that aren't dated inside (and as a result, a little sad), so the Radisson is a good choice if you want to be on the water. If not, donâ€™t stay here. If we came back, I'd stay here in a Superior Bosphorus view room here or, more likely, in the cheapest room at the Four Seasons Bosphorus to take advantage of their gorgeous facilities. Have fun in Istanbul... it's a very atmospheric city. And definitely take a Bosphorus cruise... the city looks its best from the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great hotel, superbe service”
Reviews.Author: ktulu
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a break in Istanbul and had the best experience at this hotel. The service was good, the room luxiourous and the food excellent. The fact the hotel is outcentered was a bit painful, as all the site seeing is 20mn away by car (if no traffic). The topkapi is superbe and the view on the bosphorus brilliant. We would come back

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: lambouk
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the water front. Stayed in a wet February, but bet the waterfront terrace overlooking the Bosphorus is incredible during the summer. Ate an evening meal in the restaurant and enjoyed drinks and a snack in the bar - both excellent. Free WiFi and wired internet could be quicker, but its free!

Reviews.Title: “Scmick modern hotel with good staff but not conveniently located for main attractions or public transport”
Reviews.Author: SallyNSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room for 4 nights recently. Staff were generally very good and friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern with a king bed but we found them quite small for a 5 Star standard property and also the bathrooms were not large or luxurious. We constantly felt we were stepping around each other... there wasnt anything "superior" about them...except perhaps the price! The view is nice...but to be honest we didnt spend alot of time sitting in the room admiring the view..so perhaps the price was not worth it for the bosphorus view room Be warned, the traffic in Istanbul is horrendous...the worst we have ever experienced in all our world travels (including China)...so if this is your first trip to Istanbul and you are only staying for 4 days YOU really need a hotel that is more conveniently located than the Radisson. The tram line is great but the hotel is a long distance to the nearest tram line (which takes you to the major sights _blue mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia sophia , grand basaar) and we could never navigate our way on the bus system. AND in 4 out of 5 days we were stuck in a TAXI in bad traffic jams for at least 1 hour each time, OR had to bail out of the taxi and walk back to the hotel...3-4 km...which is OK if its not raining or if you are not in a hurry but far from ideal... Do not think that you can rely on taxis because the traffic is so bad...and the only way to get around is on the trams... Next time we go to Istanbul we will stay somewhere closer to the golden horn and tram line...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Hotel but its level of customer service so not warrant 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: dellersc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson on business for a week having previously stay at the Point. The location/ view are fantastic and the rooms were extremely comfortable- although the lack of a bathrobe was something that I missed. Close by there are cute market stalls in the evenings and nice restaurants- I particularly enjoyed The House just beside the hotel. However was mentioned by previous reviews I found the service extremely poor. Firstly when checking in we were met with a cold greeting from the receptionist, I was not asked how was my flight was, etc no warmness at all was initiated. Then I it came to proceeding with my booking, they had mixed up with the previous week- these things this happen once I had a room I did not mind. However no form of an apology was offered and I was made feel like it was my fault- the customer is always right attitude obviously did not stretch to the Radisson. Maybe the Radisson and I were not meant to be as later in the seafront restaurant my order was completely mixed up! Overall the Hotel is of a good standard but its level of customer service so not warrant 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Allright, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mr_reiseglad
Reviews.Content: I was there for one night, on a businesstrip. The spa was nice, I had a great massage in the evening. The room was quite tiny, but nice. Good cleenliness, and great breakfast! The location is nice, just at the riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Go to hell... no wait, lets go to Radisson Bosphorous instead!”
Reviews.Author: tripller
Reviews.Content: You should know the worth of your hotel and its deserving stars when none of the cab drivers give you an unfamiliar nod at the mention of the name of your supposedly 5 star hotel. So on a colleague's recommendation we stayed at the Radisson Bosphorous despite its average rating, hoping to surprised. And surprised we were that in the current day and age there are hotels that are considered 5 stars, have no sense of customer service or guest regards. The hotel has no facade, yes... you have to see it to believe it... there is just a cheap neon "vegas" styled board that welcomes you. As you step in, a small.... no wait... a tiny reception with 2 persons jostling for space and air "welcome" you in a curt, cold monotone. "Did you have a good flight"..? I did not think it was a rhetoric question till I began answering it and was swiftly presented with my room keys with a icy glare. Sigh... maybe we were too pampered by our previous hotels in Greece.... maybe we were expecting too much... maybe we just wanted to feel welcome.... maybe we just wanted our money's worth. We were led into a tiny... no wait... a minuscule room with a "view" of the Bosphorous, if you can manage to squeeze your hand through the clamped windows...brush aside the bustling leaves and sneak a peek. I: "Hi, do you provide bath robes" Operator: "Yes sir" I: "I do not have them in my room" Operator: They are on request sir I: "I request you to send them" Operator: Okay sir, i will send them I: " And i need a wine opener" Operator: It is in the Mini Bar I: "No it isn't" Operator: "It is sir" I: "I checked, there is no wine opener in the bar" Operator: "There is sir" I: Pause... sigh... thank you. I: "I need for you to help me plan a romantic dinner for my wife at your restaurant by the Bosphorous" Restaurant Manager: "No outside seating as it rains in winters" I: "But its not raining today" PAUSE.... Longer PAUSE I: "Thanks for your help" I : "I need some information on restaurants nearby please" Operator: I will ask the concierge to call you back sir. WAIT... Longer WAIT Frankly, i could go on forever on accounts that Radisson has disappointed me. However, this is a fantastic area to stay in, very hip and trendy... look for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stunning view”
Reviews.Author: austria78
Reviews.Content: excellent service, fantastic view on the bosphorus, great location. i went there in july on a business trip with colleagues. I was there already many times before and the reason for coming back was that the hotel offers good service, a great location and a fantastic view on the Bosphorus. Also bars and clubs are close by, so if you go on the weekend, the Reina's and Angelique's of this world are within minutes of reach. The buzzling area of Bebek is also relatively close and buczada can also be reached from this place relatively easy. i can recommend this as one of the best spots to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town. Free WIFI and sexy suites!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsofChloe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel in the first week of August. It is a young beautiful hotel with an excellent location just by the Bosphorus strait. Very close to Istanbul's trendy places so we had the chance to try some of them with easy access. Very experienced and helpful concierge team. We stayed in a loft type suite; an amazing, sexy room with an amazing view and decoration. You have to be patient with the room service but try hotel's restaurant bar by the sea. Cool bar with trendy cocktails, a little pricey though. Breakfast is so relaxing as you watch the morning ferries and fishing boats float by. Very convenient hotel for couples who want a romantic stay and to explore Istanbul's young and trendy districts.

Reviews.Title: “The Best GEM on Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: samikohen
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Istanbul which we stayed at Radisson Bosphorus Blu at VAKKO SUIT room 612. One of the Best view of entire Bosphorus and Istanbul. Large room with living room wrap around balcony great Bedroom and enough space to invite family and friends. Hotel staff extremely helpful and knowledgeable Especially the front desk Staff which was lead By Kilic were the most qualified employee's that helped us get around in Istanbul and arranging great Boat ride (we were picked up from the hotel's restaurant right by the Bosphorus). Hotel has great Bar and perfect view along with great restaurant facility. we have dine every morning for our Breakfast and it was delightful. During my stay I also met GM Ian who was very attentive for our needs and replying my email prior to our arrival and arranging extra amenities such as Microwave for our room

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Unhappy Employees, and Dont know how they got 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: HotelHawkess
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, lack lustre and indifferent service and over priced for food and alcohol. Drinks were more expensive than best nightclubs, food bland and tiny portions. Ladies Caution: in house hair dresser run by 20 something year old's who are charging as if they were Fredric Fekkai, asked for make up application(eyeliner,shadow only) from manicure girl since lost my cosmetic bag...and charged $50! I would gladly pay a high price for QUALITY work or Service...But for BAD work and service....it makes me feel ripped off. Staff are surly and unhappy and badly trained....did not see any smiling staff faces...perhaps they need a salary raise or bonus. Seeing Surly faces just puts a negative vibe on the hotel experience. Limited closet space and free wifi that did not work....nor did it for others...so what was the point? As we pre paid, we got stuck and over five nights did not even see a manager or have any courtesy or complimentarys offered....which is unusual particularly for a small hotel. I seriously thought that the "staff" was running the entire hotel. Bizarre bathroom with a picture window into the room with a moveable screen that barely provides any privacy. So if you want to be visually intimate while toiletting...this is the place. Getting in and out of the shower with a 30inch step in...was a physical hazard...bring your own steps. The Elderly should beware! Finally, great location to be if you are going to do the club scene along the coast...convenient to get home.....BUT, abysmal everything else......what a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: SvenZH
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days on a business trip Location is nice right at the Bosporus. However traffic is very bad and it can take forever to arrive there especially in the evening . The rooms are ok nothing special but functional however the noise from the street on the car honking till late in the night gave me almost sleepless nights. Some rooms are really directly on the main road. The breakfast is nice but the bar is a joke. Half of the drinks on the menu were not available, when I complained I was told there are many bars around the hotel so they cannot opened Bottles for all the drinks the list !!! Yeah there are plenty restaurant and clubs in walking distance and that's a good thing when you stay here but then why having a hotel bar if you don't plan to have guests or offer drinks ? Internet was free but did't work well with connection dropping all the time. I would not return there , especially because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service at Starboard Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FunkyTravellerDubai
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at this hotel during our trip this June - as the location and pictures looked amazing! However, I am very happy that we didnt having taken the time to visit the hotel for lunch, which was an awful experience. I am not convinced that there is excellent Turkish Hospitality at the best of times. However, I would expect in a 5 Star branded hotel such as the Radisson, that they had the best staff available in Istanbul!! But no, this was certainly not the case. We walked into the restaurant, while we were amazed by the views, we were not approached by anyone to offer a table, even though there were plenty of waiters around and they definitely saw us! The atmosphere was stale. They all looked like they had just got out of bed, and were attending a funeral. We found ourselves a table, and after waiting 10 minutes for a menu, we asked for one and the waiter was pretty unwelcoming and might as well have thrown the menu's on the table. We asked for drinks, but this was ignored, as we were for another 10 minutes. There were 2 waiters busy making up tables right next to us rather than actually attending to us - which I found the most insulting of all! The staff should be working in the local "Kebap" House or needed some training on taking care of their guests. We really went out of our way to visit this hotel, to see what we were missing out on - apparently nothing at all! While we loved the views, our choice to stay elsewhere was the best decision made (especially having seen the other reviews here). I will thank the Manager of the restaurant, Tarek, who invited us to return and to contact him personally. However, he must have seen that the damage was done, we felt badly treated and simply wanted to leave and not return; we were not looking for a free lunch in a dull ambience and zombie waiters. Thanks to the House Cafe just 2 doors down, where we got the same stunning views and the service was excellent - they should visit them and see how its done!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but will need patience with room service”
Reviews.Author: mustang_nismo
Reviews.Content: Awesome location - bang on the Bosphorus, especially their restaurant is on the waterfront. A lot of fun places around the hotel including Angelique a popular nigh club right next door, local eateries, tea and hookah bars. Super rooms - very tastefully designed and comfortable. The only part that disappointed was sluggish room service. It took ages for the staff to replenish water, coffee and fresh glasses each day (something that shouldnt need a reminder at a hotel like this). What made this even challenging was that none of the room service staff understood English

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: FarNWide
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Amazing location (at first it seems really far from the main attractions, but its a really quaint little neighborhood). Only bad thing was that on weekends there is a club right next door which is really noisy till about 2am. So I wouldn't recommend it with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Visit”
Reviews.Author: DanyalA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Radisson for a total of 4 nights with family and friends. The hotel had the most unbelievable views I have seen in a place like this and I could see the clear blue river from the windows. It would have been nice if there were balconies but there were none throughout the whole building. The hotel had 2 different wings, one with the river view and one with the street view. The location of the hotel was not very good and not walking distance to any tourist place near. The hotel was in a peaceful sleepy town full of locals and nice restaurants and bars just 1 or 2 minutes round the back. When we got to the area of the hotel, it was a real struggle to find the hotel entrance because it was on a sidestreet with no significant nor extravagant entrance. The trip from the Intl Airport to the hotel was pretty long and cost us around Â£40. Overall the trip was very pleasant with kind staff and clean rooms, the rooms were contemporary and food was great. I would recommend a visit here are long as you don't mind being too far from the main city centre.

Reviews.Title: “the view is amazing....”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissDee
Reviews.Content: I used my frequent flyer miles and stayed at this very nice hotel. the hotel is small and cosy. and it has THE most amazing view of the river, bridge and mosque. it really takes your breath away.. absolutely stunning view when lit at night !! just don't eat at the over priced bar/restaurant. there are plenty of places just outside the hotel. upon check in we were offered a 50 euro a night upgrade. we got a nice, quite big room on the top floor with water view. comfortable beds. the breakfast was rich with plenty of things to choose from. the location is ok. a 10 min taxi ride from all the busy city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: negunio
Reviews.Content: spent 4 days in this hotel! Staff very friendly, helpful. I could spend all day having breakfast with stunning view on Bosphorus. Very good local transport connection with tourist attractions, not expensive and quick. No need to take taxi - always offered by reception staff which is quite annoying. Cleanliness maybe not pefect but ok! Wellness club worth to visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Special”
Reviews.Author: ulialves
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel with a wonderfull view special during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Conditional Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Ucko
Reviews.Content: We stayed one Saturday night in this hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. We chose it because of its location: close to bars and restaurants and we thought it would also have a romantic and beautiful Bosphorus view. If our room was not upgraded, I think the latter expectation would not have been met at all: there are very few rooms with proper Bosphorus view, so you have to make sure it before you go, otherwise, you might end up with a room looking into the busy steet. If you want to spend money, make sure you reserve the "Vakko Suite", it's a very spacious executive room, on the Boshorus faÃ§ade of the hotel with a large terrace and it's really very nice. Other business rooms are all equipped with necessary services and tools but are really small in comparison to other such luxurious hotels' rooms. The food is the weakest part of the hotel: both the lunch and room service breakfast experiences we had were disappointing in terms of taste, definitely not in terms of display though. I would not recommend the spa at all: we both had arometherapy massages: massage rooms were cold and both massage therapists were coughing and sneezing all the time, which, of course, made us a bit unconfortable in terms of hygiene. Furthermore, my massage therapist has stopped the massage 3 times in 1 hour and left the room, I guess due to her flu. Overall, our spa experience was quite disappointing. Just as written by some tripadvisor members, at the check-out we also experienced the billing problem: though we had made our reservation via a travel agency and room fee was pre-paid, they charged it once again and after a long conversation, they accepted there was a mistake and as an apology, they deducted some of our extra expenses, which was nice indeed as customer care. Despite the negative aspects, we liked the hotel as we were staying there only 1 night and we had a relatively beautiful room. But if I were to stay longer, I think the size of the room would become suffocating in time. I would recommend the hotel rather for shorter and rather for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: I paid EUR 150 for a room- but after tax and breakfast it was more like EUR 200. I thought breakfast was expensive, like in most hotels of this caliber- although the view from teh breakfast area over the Bosporus was great. The location is good- Ortakoy offers bars and restaurants right at your doorstep, but the hotel is a bit far from other tourist attractions like Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque. Wifi was free- as i should be in all hotels but it rarely is. It worked well. Overall a flawless experience.

Reviews.Title: “Raddisson blu bosporus”
Reviews.Author: SveinS3
Reviews.Content: Good service and exellent wiew for bosporus passage, high standard rooms and good food

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel with superb views”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Istanbul. It really is a monster of a City - a huge, sprawling, self-confident Megalopolis. It's totally awe-inspiring and not the sort of place to go to if you want to relax, but endlessly fascinating & surprising. Ortakoy is not dead-centre, but is a popular area for discerning inhabitants of Istanbul. The Radisson Blu Bosphorous is about a 30-40 minute taxi-ride from the airport (rush hour permitting) and is tucked away off a main road, at least at its rear. Inside it is plush and clean. The staff greeted me warmly and were very efficient. My room was very clean and tidy, with twin beds and a modern bathroom. The hotel offers free internet connection and a modern flat-screen TV. Downstairs, the cafe & bar give you a hint of the real assets of this hotel. There are great views over the Bosphorous including, on a clear day, a glimpse of the Topkapi Palace and the Hagia Sophia mosque. Outside is a terrace restaurant which is right by the water with great views of the Bosphorous Bridge. As my visit was in January, the outside terrace wasn't in use, but it must be a spectacular place to have dinner in late spring and summer. I can't think of many negative points. Several of the main tourist sights (eg the Blue Mosque) are almost 10 kms away - but then Istanbul is HUGE. My laptop also got infected by a 'trojan' via the hotel's free internet access. aside from this, I'd say this has to be one of the top 'hotels with a view' in Istanbul. I had three pleasant nights there and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: OorWullieSydney
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel. Large modern rooms and right on the banks of the Bosphorus. The standard of service by ALL staff is outstanding and they are to be commended for that. For those who like to go clubbing, Angelique (one of the best and newer clubs) is right next door, with the ever popular Reina only 5 minutes away. We've stayed in many top hotels around the world and I have to say that the Radisson, surprisingly, is up there with the best.. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: JoCollinsipswich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a short city break at the hotel to celebrate my 30th Birthday so we wanted something special and were really delighted with the hotel. We booked a standard room however on arrival were upgraded much to our surprise to a room which looked out onto the Bosphorus bridge and the river/mosque. The bridge is stunning at night when it is lit by various colour lights (see photo). The room was well proportioned and we had some fun with the glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom..remember to put the blind up! Bed very comfy, however TV stations limited, but then you don't travel to watch the TV do you? The hotel further surprised us with a complimentary bottle of fizz, cake and card. The hotel bar has a gorgeous view of the river, unfortunatley the weather wasn't great so we weren't able to make use of the outside terrace - I would imagine it would be breathtaking gazing over to Asia in the summer month. The restaurant at the hotel and room service are both at 5* prices! We would recommend a 1 minute walk to the House Cafe across the road or Levante which is just around the corner in the direction of the Mosque. Transfer wise we would recommend ataturkairportshuttle.com which was reliable and door-to-door at a very reasonable price compared to some option we explored.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed in for a long while !”
Reviews.Author: Mardood
Reviews.Content: I could be all day writing about this hotel but I won't. Price it up and if it is within your budget go and stay there, do not consider anywhere else unless there is a similar review to this. It is just fantastic, one negative - do not use the minibar, the price list is not easy to find at over 5 Euro for a 300ml can of drink is ridiculous, go to the shop at the top of the road on the right and buy drinks for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, nice, good location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: dmasata
Reviews.Content: State-of-the-art 4 star business traveller hotel. Also suitable for families but taxi required to get into the old part of the city. Very nice bar and restaurant location with terrace right onto the Bosphorus, which gives great views. Very popular club right next door (good for those who want to visit it at night, not so good for those who have their room right next to that building). The best about this hotel are the very modern and nicely decorated rooms - well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 2W3
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a great and diverse city with many interesting nooks. The Radisson is located in one of the gems, Ortakoy. In addition to being the only hotel located in the heart of Ortakoy, it sits directly on the Bosphorus and has a great view of Sultanahmet (which is the main tourist destination in Istanbul). The down side is that with traffic, it can take roughly 30 minutes to get to any of the major tourist sites in Sultanahmet. The hotel itself is a Scandinavian business hotel. Tastefully appointed, but sparse in design, the hotel is clearly purpose built. The rooms are on the small side, but very comfortable and for the business traveler, they are more than adequate. You will not find LCD TVs or iPod hook-ups, but you do get internet and a very comfortable bed. Some of the rooms have partial views of the Bosphorus, but do not count on getting one as they are rare. They do have "Business Class" rooms which will give you a better view and more room, but they are significantly more expensive. The service is of high quality and very prompted and helpful. The hotel car met me on time and the trip took about 45 minutes. The front desk is very helpful and recommended some great restaurants nearby. One of the highlights of the hotel is their buffet breakfast. You can sit alongside the Bosphorus and enjoy a choice of traditional turkish and common western choices. All are prepared perfectly! If you are a business person who is looking to stay out of the chaos of sultanahmet and want a unique experience, this is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, free internet, same food everyday, and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: janetinabudhabi
Reviews.Content: We came here on a tour with Fly Express Tourism out of Dubai. They chose a Tour company that had limited english speaking capability so it was somewhat hampered in imparting any knowledge of the history. We spent a quarter of the tour waiting for other tourists to show up and went back and forth between hotels waiting for them to get up because they had not all been informed of the correct departure time. They insisted upon us having to be picked up first as our hotel was so far out. The hotel was nice enough to book us to a larger room but wanted more money if we wanted a room with a view. The free interenet worked well and the room was very clean and had nice wood floors. I would recommend the hotel again however, the buffet included in the room price lacked any spontaneity. Someone should buy the chef a cookbook as he is so uninspired and made exactly the same thing everyday. Which was ok the first day but grew tiresome from there on. Roast potatoes, warm precooked pancakes, hard-boiled eggs, good bacon, broiled tomatoes, etc. Usual fruits and yoghurts, nice breads, cold croissants etc. Great coffee! People were very friendly but English is only understood by some. The bar was great and very accomodating and made whatever you wanted. Location of the hotel is outstanding especially if you want to go to clubs as they ware within walking distance and so is outdoor market to buy kitche stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Posh Posh”
Reviews.Author: DrCorona
Reviews.Content: Ok this was different than my previous Radisson experiences. This hotel is located in a cool district, looks smart and attracts posh people. But as previous people said (and as you may have understood) it is not in the quiet part of town. If you open your window, the wall of sound hits you. But keep it closed and youll get a good nights sleep. No problems with AC in my room. Really enjoyed the restaurant, but it was expensive (even compared with my homecontry, vintage champagne is worth its weight in gold it seems). Views are super, clientele chic and the DJ really tries to be (to) cool. The staff was really helpful, and took good care of all our problems. The only problem for us was the endless traffic jams on the way from Ataturk airport to Ortakoy. The last part would go way faster on foot, even with the heavy luggage. I would come back, depending on the purpose of the trip. To have a good time - Yes, to relax - No. The four seasons bosphorus is close and quiet. It is the better choise - if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “The Location was very scenic,but the A/c was not working and it was very hotand stuffy in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: onaizak
Reviews.Content: The Location was very scenic, but accessability was not at all easy,a lot of traffic and also too many transport problems to get there, their Airconditioning was not working,rooms were hot and stuffy and staff kept promising it will be fixed,but they did nothing about it. I would not reccommend this hotel to a friend or anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in 40 Years”
Reviews.Author: Traveler56789
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay on Expedia at this hotel for an October, 2008 date and prepaid for the room as required. Since this was the last night of our vacation, I wanted something special. I had booked the second highest priced room, a â€œBosphorusâ€� room with the understanding that this was a room on the Bosphorus Straight (waterfront) side on the hotel. When we checked in, I showed the desk clerk my receipt from Expedia showing prepayment. I was asked to provide a credit card, which I assumed was needed to cover any extra charges. We were given a room on the street side of the hotel. When I complained and again showed the front desk the Expedia reservation they explained that no other rooms were available. So instead of a room overlooking the Bosphorus, we looked down on one of the busiest streets in Istanbul. At checkout it was clear that I had not received a credit for my prepayment through Expedia. Once again I showed the desk clerk, and then the manager, my receipt from Expedia. Despite this the manager insisted I owed the full amount without my prepayment to Expedia. We were then in a hurry to get to the airport, and I assumed that this could be fairly easily corrected later. Little did I know that it would take six months plus to resolve this matter. In the process of trying to straighten this out Radisson applied two different credits which made no sense, and then a charge which was also incorrect. Over time, I made three lengthy telephone calls (one of which was an hour and 45 minutes) to my credit card company attempting to resolve this matter. After each of the three phone calls I provided detailed follow up letters to my credit card, because the agents continued to be understandably confused by the Radisson transactions. Finally, six months later on May 1, 2009, I received a correct refund. It will be a long time before I stay at a Radisson again. Also, my conclusion is that I will not book through Expedia again. I just adds an intermediary that can confuse matters. In addition, Expedia requires prepayment, when if you booked directly with the hotel they seldom require prepayment. Note that Expedia is typically collecting a healthy percentage of the room charge (I believe 20%), plus keeping the same percentage of the room tax (for which they have been successfully sued by local governments) plus then charging an added fee. You often can get a lower rate by dealing directly with the hotel. Why not give the money to a well run hotel, instead of Expedia, and avoid the prepayment?

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service at Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drummingtosca
Reviews.Content: The location of the Radisson Blu Bosphorus, right on the shore of the Bosphorus at the foot of the Bosphorus bridge, cannot be beat. The area is lively with interesting shops, cafes, restaurants, and a beautiful Baroque-style Mosque. The restaurant's outdoor terrace is right by the water, allowing diners to gaze at the blue waters, boats, and the Asian side of Istanbul while dining. It's quite a romantic view. The service at the hotel was fabulous. The staff at the front desk was always helpful, checking taxi rates for us, recommending ways to get around town, and talking to drivers for us when the driver didn't speak English (and we unfortunately didn't speak Turkish). The hair salon delivered a great head message for me and an impressive old-fashioned shave for my boyfriend. The general manager of the hotel deserves special mention for his attentiveness, friendliness, and discreet demeanor that reminded me of a true gentleman from bygone eras. One evening, when we took a long taxi ride to Karakoy on the Asian side, our taxi driver tried to cheat us by taking a route that was twice as long as was normal. We discovered this (why do such taxi drivers always assume we haven't been to the place before just because we don't speak the local language, or that we won't have a map with us?), and an argument broke out at our destination when we would only pay the amount that the hotel quoted us as the usual fare. When it looked like the taxi driver wouldn't back down, we called the Radisson to ask for translation assistance, and the general manager did a great job intervening in the matter, brokering a compromise by phone so that we could get out of the situation safely. He then did follow up after we returned to the hotel to make sure we were ok. We were very impressed by this level of service. The only negative things about the hotel were that I felt the room decor was too utilitarian and that the restaurant food was overpriced yet ordinary. For those who had rooms with a view of the Bosphorus, the lack of interesting decor probably would not have mattered much. However, since we had a room overlooking the street and the garage, it just felt like any room in any corporate hotel in any part of the world, a dark one at that since the buildings across the street blocked direct sunlight. The restaurant service was great, but the food had no flavor and was nothing special. Yet, a dinner for two with no alcohol came to about $90. In contrast, when we ate out at one of the local restaurants, which offered Turkish dishes with rich flavors, we only paid $20 total for two people. Despite the drawbacks, this is a good valued hotel. The room rates were very reasonable for the location, and the staff's service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Czechs
Reviews.Content: To start of with, although I prepaid for our (my colleague and I) stay in the hotel and this was arranged beforehand, but come the day of my check-in, the front desk still asks me for payment. After I showed her the remittance proof, she apologized but still asks for my credit card. To add on, on the day I check-out, again the desk manager ask how I would like to settle payment. Again I have to show him the remittance proof. Though he apologized still this should not have happened at the first place. The registration system should have been updated before our arrival. Despite this, the air-conditioning in our room wasnâ€™t functioning. We had to open up the windows but the noise outside was unbearable. I was told that the air-conditioning system had some problem which couldnâ€™t be fixed overnight. What disappointing most is we were not offered to change room at all. To make matter worst, on the subject of privacy, I was informed that the maintenance guy will come to fix the air-conditioner at 12.30pm. At 11am while I was in the wc after shower with the door open, there was 2 guys knocking on our door and rush in immediately after 1 knock only. He did not even have the courtesy to introduce himself first; room service or maintenance, at least knock, shout and wait for respond from inside the room before bumping in as if no one is inside. I could quite clearly see the two men faces inside the wc, half naked. Again, the hotel shows no sign of remedy. This is very bad. Toilet rolls and tissues inside the bathroom were not replenished despite â€œPlease clean roomâ€� sign has been put up. Overall, my impression was one of a disappointment. We are very unimpressed with the staff; the operator sounded pressured and agitated as we call to complaint the air conditioner and maintenance guys, annoyed by the front desk and the inefficient registration system and most importantly no common courtesy and respect of guestâ€™s privacy. This is seriously my worst experience with a 5 star rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic business hotel on the bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: daniksta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was typical scandinavian, clean, neat and minimal. The staff were efficient and friendly. The view from the hotel room was fantastic! looking over the bosphorus, the all inclusive breakfast buffet was very good as well. Room service food was not too great, i suggest you step outside, there are plenty of restaurants a minutes walk away. The restaurant right next door japanese restaurant, Zuma, was really good but very very expensive (a meal for four with sake was around 500$'s!) , probably has one of the best views around as its right on the waterfront. The hotels next to the radisson are more upmarket, the four season and ciran palace, but they are also a lot more expensive. Also the radisson has no real turkish design influences so you could think you were a hotel anywhere else in the world and especially in scandinavia, except when you look out the window afcourse. Overall it's a nice luxurious business hotel with no hassles and a very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gyllenbock
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights i Februari in this clean and very nice hotel. The hotel is just a couple of years old, everything felt fresh. Our room was rather spacious and very clean, modern and well equipped. Free wireless internet access is always a good thing when staying in a Radisson SAS Hotel. The location of the hotel is very close to the Bosphorus in Ortakoy, 10 kilometers from the famous sights as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and others. The taxi was fairly fast and cheap compared to taxis in western countries. The trip to the airport took a long time due to heavy traffic. I did like the neighbourhood of Ortakoy with many cafes and restaurants. Great evening walks in the area around the hotel. The breakfast was very good with a great variety of alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Orkatoy”
Reviews.Author: barbara1971
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, business style. The location is great, in Ortakoy, just a couple of minutes walk to the Orkatoy Mocidiye Mosque, a great place to hang out in the evening. The room is spacious, I had the pleasure of being upgrated. The (small) business center is free. The bar and the restaurant have a great view on the Bosphore. Only issue : it is a bit far from the airport : well over one hour drive if you arrive at bad traffic hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not efficient”
Reviews.Author: emekli
Reviews.Content: Although I prepaid the travel agent for my stay in the hotel they charged my credit card for this stay for close to $3K Cdn. instead of sending their invoice to the travel agent to whom they addressed. I have been trying to get them correct their mistake for almost 2 years to credit my card with no result.

Reviews.Title: “Great hip hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ingridka
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best city break hotel which a ever stayed. They upgrade us to a studio room with spacious bathroom, kitchen corner and nice view over the Ortakoy district. The location is perfect just next to the bank. The breakfast was great and worth for money. The spa are bit pricey but very modern. The newly opened sushi place with a great outdoor terrace is a hip spot for a Istanbul society and ex-pats. For sure a hotel which I will recommend and hopefully come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: morghi76
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Istanbul. I did not know much about the city, nor I had time to google around to find the best hotel. I went there for business, so I relied on the opinion of my colleagues who are working there. Their advice proved to be excellent! The Hotel is located in Ortakoy, a cozy block near the first bridge. It's far from the center and abt 45 minutes by taxi from the airport, the only downside of this accommodation. The building has just been renovated, the rooms are brand new, nicely decorated with the Scandinavian touch - which actually gives you a kind of weird feeling, as sometimes you think you are in Stockholm, not in Istanbul - the lounge has a magnificent view on the Bosphorus. Breakfast is just as good as you would expect it to be. I must say I loved my stay in Radisson Bosphorus! A small hitch to report: the complementary Wi-Fi broadband connection is fast for standard mailing and office work, but it's lame when it comes to watching streaming videos like youtube ones. After all not a big deal: you're not supposed to be staying long in your room when you are in Istanbul: there's a lot to do and to see!

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of 5 star status”
Reviews.Author: scoobylondon
Reviews.Content: AVOID THE RADISSON CHAIN. ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE ON HONEYMOON! Very disappointed with this particular hotel in the Radisson group, and overall unimpressed with the standard that they offer as a 5 star hotel. We planned to stay at the Radisson on the night of our wedding, which we had held close by. As it was effectively the beginning of our honeymoon, we had visited Istanbul a few months beforehand to make arrangements and had requested that we have a particular room with a view in which we would also use to take photos. This was arranged beforehand, but come the day, we were not allowed to enter the room (which we had previously booked AND confirmed verbally (both in English and Turkish, and so understanding their reassurances in different languages!) as it had been allocated to someone else! Furthermore, despite having received the okay beforehand, we were told not to take bridal photos in the lobby as it would disturb other guests - insane! There was no one there, which is how I usually find the lobby at the Radisson, and furthermore, how could 5-10 minutes of snapping a bride disturb anyone? After a lot of apologising from the desk manager (a nice guy, but had obviously been overruled by his faceless and unforgiving management), we were shown a smaller room with a view (not as good as the one we had booked), but which SMELT terribly of sewage PLUS could hear the nightclub downstairs VERY clearly. Nice start to our honeymoon. I still wish to this day that I had booked the Kempinski Palace as the honeymoon treat instead! Breakfast was nothing special (Swiss Otel Bosporus breakfasts are far superior), the usual clinical fare. Having stayed at a lot of 5 star hotels in Istanbul, I would recommend the Marmara for a cheaper stay and Kempinski for a more luxe stay or one of the boutique hotels in and around IStanbul (though a lot of them are not that central). BUT DON'T STAY AT THE RADISSON, THEY DO NOT LOOK AFTER THE CUSTOMER! Despite this, the following week we still booked in at the Radission in Rome for 1 night. You may ask why - well as 5-star hotels go, it was cheap! And that I think is what the inherent problem is - the Radisson clearly cuts a lot of corners in their rooms, and a lot of things feel that they are low quality and built cheaply, yet you are supposed to be staying at a 5 star hotel. But in reality, you are not getting 5 star, which is why people's expectations are higher than they ought to be. The Radisson does not deserve its 5 star claims and I would place it at a 4 star instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but poor location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: Family of three stayed 5 nights at the Radisson SAS Bosphorus in December 2007. The hotel is first class,very new and the staff are efficient and friendly. The major problem with this hotel ,if you are a tourist to Istranbul,is it's location.It is in Ortakoy and in normal Istanbul traffic,which is pretty horrendous,can take you anything up to 45 minutes by taxi to Taxim square or Sultanahmet. We normally like to take a mid day break from siteseeing around 2-3 PM and go back out for another round in town in the early evening.With the hotel being so far away it just wasn't practical. The Metro/Light Rail of Istanbul also doesn't help much as it ends in Kabatas and from there you need a cab anyway. The neighbourhood of Ortakoy is very nice,with cafes and restaurants on the pier,right by the bosphurus bridge and the Oratkoy Mosque.A small handicrafts market is always on hand as well. Another down side of the Radisson SAS is the pricing for the extra's. We paid 210 Euro per night for a triple room which is reasonable nowadays for a 5 star in Istanbul.But this price did not include breakfast - they charged us 20 Euro per person for the buffet breakfast - which we indulged in once.Other mornings we either went straight to town or went down to a cafe in Ortakoy where u can get a Turkish Breakfast platter for around 12.50 YTL per person. The Hotel has a Hamam - They charged me 140 YTL for a 40 min's Turkish massage and use of the sauna and spa.Comparable rates in first class Hamam's in town,albeit NOT in a 5 star hotel,run for c 60 YTL for a similar experience. The hotel also has a hair dresser and we made the mistake of bringing our 9 year old daughter for a hair cut.I have very little hair left but I was convinced to also have a shave,manicure,head massage etc. Before we knew what was going on they charged us 225 YTL (c $200) for the pleasure.When we contacted the reception to complain they checked with the salon and returned to us explaining that the prices we were charged were actually quite reasonable for a 5 star hotel in Istanbul. Just for futur reference anyone who go's to Istanbul will notice that they have more hair salons per capita than any other place in the world I have seen! Just stop into any decent looking one and you will get spoiled rotten at 1/3 the price we paid. All in all the Radisson SAS is not the place for tourists - there is no shortage of 5 star hotels in the Taxim area or the Sultanahemet tourist area.
